sentences.japanese: 今日はどうでしたか？
天気はどうですか？

sentences.english: What are you going to do?
sentences.japanese: 何をするつもりですか？
sentences.reading: Nani o suru tsumori desu ka?

sentences.japanese: ゆっくりどうぞ。
私が言っているのはそれです。
sentences.reading: Watashi ga itte iru no wa sore desu.

sentences.english: Is there a hotel in this area?
sentences.japanese: この地域にホテルはありますか？
sentences.reading: Kono chiiki ni hoteru wa arimasu ka?

sentences.english: I don’t know what to say.
sentences.japanese: 何を言えばいいかわかりません。
sentences.reading: Nani o ieba ii ka wakarimasen.

sentences.japanese: 出発しようとしています。

sentences.english: Did you clean up in here?
sentences.japanese: ここを掃除しましたか？
それについて聞いたことがありますか？
sentences.reading: Sore ni tsuite kiita koto ga arimasu ka?

sentences.english: Please take me to the market.
sentences.japanese: 市場に連れて行ってください。
なぜおしゃれをしていますか？
好きな映画俳優は誰ですか？
sentences.reading: Suki na eiga haiyuu wa dare desu ka?

sentences.english: Would you like to have some coffee?
sentences.japanese: コーヒーはいかがですか？
疲れているようですね。
私は元気です。

sentences.english: I think we need to talk about it.
sentences.korean: 내 생각에 우리 이야기를 해봐야 할 것 같아.
sentences.japanese: それについて話す必要があると思います。
sentences.reading: Sore ni tsuite hanasu hitsuyou ga aru to omoimasu.

sentences.korean: 그건 하지 않는 편이 좋을 것 같아.
sentences.japanese: それはしたくないです。
最後まで聞いてください。
今日は暇です。
今、何時ですか？
手伝ってくれますか？
お腹が空きました。
散歩に行きましょう。

sentences.english: Do you want to join us?
sentences.japanese: 私たちに参加しますか？
また後で会いましょう。
どう思いますか？
お会いできて嬉しいです。
週末はどうでしたか？
好きな食べ物は何ですか？
sentences.reading: Suki na tabemono wa nan desu ka?

sentences.english: Do you have any plans for today?
sentences.japanese: 今日は何か予定がありますか？
sentences.reading: Kyou wa nanika yotei ga arimasu ka?

sentences.japanese: この歌が大好きです！

sentences.english: What time do you usually wake up?
sentences.japanese: 普段は何時に起きますか？
sentences.reading: Fudan wa nanji ni okimasu ka?

sentences.japanese: その映画を見ましたか？
昼食を取りに行きましょう。
好きな趣味は何ですか？
sentences.reading: Suki na shumi wa nan desu ka?

sentences.english: I need to go grocery shopping.
sentences.japanese: 食料品の買い物に行く必要があります。
sentences.reading: Shokuryouhin no kaimono ni iku hitsuyou ga arimasu.

sentences.english: Can you recommend a good book?
sentences.japanese: 良い本を勧めてくれますか？
sentences.reading: Yoi hon o susumete kuremasu ka?

sentences.english: What did you do last night?
sentences.japanese: 昨晩は何をしましたか？
sentences.reading: Sakuban wa nani o shimashita ka?

sentences.english: I’m looking forward to the weekend.
sentences.japanese: 週末が楽しみです。

sentences.english: Do you want to watch a movie tonight?
sentences.japanese: 今夜映画を見ませんか？
好きな季節は何ですか？
sentences.reading: Suki na kisetsu wa nan desu ka?

sentences.japanese: 料理をするのが好きです。
sentences.reading: Ryouri o suru no ga suki desu.

sentences.english: What type of music do you like?
sentences.japanese: どんな音楽が好きですか？
sentences.reading: Donna ongaku ga suki desu ka?

sentences.english: I’m planning to travel next month.
sentences.japanese: 来月旅行する予定です。
スポーツをしますか？
夢の仕事は何ですか？
sentences.reading: Yume no shigoto wa nan desu ka?

sentences.japanese: ハイキングに行くのが好きです。
sentences.reading: Haikingu ni iku no ga suki desu.

sentences.japanese: 好きな飲み物は何ですか？
sentences.reading: Suki na nomimono wa nan desu ka?

sentences.english: I need to finish my homework.
sentences.japanese: 宿題を終わらせる必要があります。
sentences.reading: Shukudai o owaraseru hitsuyou ga arimasu.

sentences.japanese: 明日会えますか？

sentences.english: I’m feeling a bit under the weather.
sentences.japanese: 体調が少し良くありません。
良い一日を！
近いうちに会いましょう。
後で電話します。
好きな休日は何ですか？
sentences.reading: Suki na kyujitsu wa nan desu ka?

sentences.japanese: もっと健康的に食べようとしています。
sentences.reading: Motto kenkou-teki ni tabeyou to shiteimasu.

sentences.english: What’s your favorite place to visit?
sentences.japanese: 好きな訪れる場所はどこですか？
sentences.reading: Suki na otozureru basho wa doko desu ka?

sentences.japanese: 新しい言語を学んでいます。

sentences.english: What do you do for fun?
sentences.japanese: 楽しむために何をしますか？
sentences.reading: Tanoshimu tame ni nani o shimasu ka?

sentences.english: Don't run away, you coward! Don't run away!!!
sentences.korean: 도망치지 마! 이 비겁자야! 도망치지 마!!
sentences.japanese: 逃げるな卑怯者!!逃げるなァ!!!

sentences.english: The Demon Slayer Corps always fights in the darkness of night, which is advantageous to you!
sentences.korean: 우리 귀살대는 언제나 너희에게 유리한 한밤의 어둠 속에서 싸우고 있어
sentences.japanese: いつだって鬼殺隊はお前らに有利な夜の闇の中で戦ってるんだ！
sentences.reading: 이츠닷테 키사츠타이와 오마에라니 유리나 요루노 야미노나카데 타타캇테룬다!!

sentences.english: We're flesh and blood humans! Wounds don't heal easily! Lost limbs don't grow back!
sentences.korean: 살아있는 인간이 말이다! 상처도 쉽게 아물지 않는데! 잃어버린 팔다리가 돌아오는 일도 없는데!
sentences.japanese: 生身の人間がだ！きずだって簡単には塞がらない！失った手足が戻ることもない！
sentences.reading: 나마미노 닝겐가다! 키즈닷테 칸탄니와 후사가라나이! 우시낫타 테아시가 모도루 코토모나이!!

sentences.english: Don't run away, you idiot! You coward!
sentences.japanese: 逃げるな馬鹿野郎！馬鹿野郎！　卑怯者！

sentences.english: Rengoku-san is much more amazing than you! He's stronger!
sentences.korean: 너 같은 놈보다 렌고쿠씨가 훨씬 더 대단해! 강해!
sentences.japanese: お前なんかより、煉獄さんの方がずっと凄いんだ！強いんだ！

sentences.english: Rengoku-san didn't lose! He didn't let anyone die! He fought to the end! He protected everyone to the end!
sentences.korean: 렌고쿠씨는 지지않았어! 아무도 죽게 놔두지않았어! 끝까지 싸웠다고! 끝까지 지켜냈다고!
sentences.japanese: 煉獄さんは負けてない！ 誰も死なせなかった！戦い抜いた！　守り抜いた！
sentences.reading: 렌고쿠상와 마케테나이! 다레모 시나세나캇타!! 타타카이 누이타! 마모리 누이타!!

sentences.japanese: お前の負けだ！煉獄さんの 勝ちだ！

sentences.english: What is that brat saying, does he not have a brain in his head?
sentences.japanese: 何を言ってるんだあのガキは, 脳味噌が頭に詰まってないのか？
sentences.reading: 난오 잇테룬다 아노 가키와, 노오미소가 아타마니 츠맛테나이노카?

sentences.japanese: おまえ おれの 仲間に なれ

sentences.english: I will become the Pirate King!
sentences.japanese: 俺は 海賊王に なる!

sentences.english: I am the man who will become the Pirate King!
sentences.japanese: 俺は 海賊王に なる 男だ!
仲間だろ!!!
なみ!! おまえわ おれの 仲間だ!!!
遅い
鬼切り

sentences.english: A scar on the back is a swordsman's shame.
sentences.japanese: 背中の 傷は 剣士の 恥だ。
何も なかった。

sentences.english: I will become the world's greatest swordsman.
sentences.japanese: 俺は 世界 一の 剣豪に なるんだ

sentences.english: Sorry, but I've never prayed to God.
sentences.korean: 미안하지만 난 신에게 기도한 적 없어
sentences.japanese: 悪いが 俺は 神に 祈ったことはねぇ
sentences.reading: 와루이가 오레와 카미니 이놋타 코토와 네에

sentences.english: A man forgives a woman's lie.
sentences.japanese: 女の 嘘は 許すことが 男だ
助けて

sentences.english: I came to end this war.
sentences.japanese: この 戦争を 終わらせに 来た
人は 神を 恐れるのでは ない
まさに 恐怖が 神だ

sentences.english: When do you think people die?
sentences.japanese: 人は 何時 死ぬと 思う
人に 忘れられた ときさ

sentences.english: Chopper, you can become the best doctor. I guarantee it!
sentences.korean: 쵸파 너는 최고의 의사가 될꺼야 그건 내가 보증하지!
sentences.japanese: チョッパ、お前は 最高の 医者に なれるさ。俺が 保証する！
sentences.reading: 춉파, 오마에와 사이코-노 이샤니 나레루사. 오레가 호-쇼-스루!

sentences.english: It really was a good life!!!
sentences.japanese: まったくいい人生だった！！！

sentences.english: Luffy, come to a high place!
sentences.japanese: ルピー, 高い所に来なさい!
愛してくれて ありがとう
これが 最後の一撃か

sentences.english: I never even thought about losing.
sentences.japanese: 俺が 負けるなんて 考えた事も なかった

sentences.english: Is this the strongest power in the world?
sentences.japanese: これが世界最強の力か

sentences.english: Don't rush to your death, young swordsman.
sentences.japanese: 生き急ぐな 若き力よ

sentences.english: It's still too early for you to die.
sentences.japanese: 貴様が死ぬにはまだ早い
文句あるか

sentences.english: If you give up, that's where the game ends.
sentences.japanese: あきらめたら、そこで 試合 終了だよ

sentences.english: Coach Anzai... I want to play basketball.
sentences.japanese: 安西先生…バスケが したいです

sentences.english: Yeah, I'm Mitsui. A man who doesn't give up easily.
sentences.korean: 그래 난 정대만. 포기를 모르는 남자지...
sentences.japanese: おう オレは三井。あきらめの悪い男
sentences.reading: 오오 오레와 미츠이 아키라메노 와루이 오토코

sentences.english: Show me your fighting spirit, Hisashi-kun.
sentences.japanese: 鬪志を 見せてくれ 壽くん

sentences.english: For now, become the best high school student in Japan.
sentences.korean: 우선 너는 일본 제일의 고등학생이 되어라
sentences.japanese: とりあえず君は日本一の高校生になりなさい

sentences.english: The left hand is just for support.
sentences.japanese: 左手は そえるだけ
天才ですから。

sentences.english: Of course, because I'm a genius.
sentences.japanese: もちろん 俺は天才だから

sentences.english: When five people gather, there's always one trash among them.
sentences.korean: 인간이 5명이나 모이면 말이야 반드시 1명은 쓰레기가 있다
sentences.japanese: 人間 五人も 集まるとな 必ず一人クズがいる。
sentences.reading: 닌겐 고닌모 아츠마루토나 카나라즈 히토리 쿠즈가이루

sentences.english: I never go back on my word. That's my ninja way!
sentences.korean: 한 번 한 말은 결코 굽히지 않아 그게 내 닌자의 길이야
sentences.japanese: まっすぐ 自分の 言葉は 曲げねぇ これが 俺の 忍道だ
sentences.reading: 맛스구 지분노 코토바와 마게네에 코레가 오레노 닌도다

sentences.english: I'll never let my comrades die.
sentences.korean: 내 동료는 절대 죽게 두지 않아
sentences.japanese: オレの仲間は絶対殺させやしないよ。

sentences.english: Sorry, but I'll end this in an instant.
sentences.japanese: 悪いが 一瞬で終わらせてもらうぞ。
ま, これはオレの役目だ。

sentences.english: Hidden Leaf Village Secret Finger Jutsu: One Thousand Years of Death!
sentences.korean: 나뭇잎 닌자 마을 비전의 체술 오의! 천년 죽이기!
sentences.japanese: 木の葉隠れ秘伝体術奥義！千年殺し～っ！
これはいくらですか
